授業目的:
To gain familiarity with religiousity and religious organizations in Japan through field-studies and studies of primary and secondary texts in the context of the course book.
To review the history of religions in Japan from pre-history till now.
To polish the academic skills in the field of the study of religion.
到達目標:
The participant will gain an introductory level of knowledge about the history and teachings/characteristics of the main religions in Japan, Shinto and Buddhism. 
She/he will demonstrate her/his grasp of them in a series of quizzes based on the textbook, present first-hand experiences from field studies, and demonstrate her/his academic skills in oral and written works.
授業方法: Face to face format. The class structure of this course will be: short lecture on the topic, class discussion and participation and summation of the issues.  Students will be expected to have read the assigned materials prior to the class and prepare to respond to the questions raised in the class.

第1回: 4/11 Introduction to the course.  Visit Uegahara Hachiman Shrine.

Familiarize yourself with the course book.
On LUNA, post a short essay = 1-2 pages A4 about your observations at the shrine. Read Chapter 1.
第2回: 4/18 Bring your lunch. We take a taxi from the area infront of the Shin Gakusei Kaikan to Kanno-ji, just above our campus, eat lunch and visit the temple. We walk down and observe other expressions of faith on the way.

Read Chapter 2 and the description of Himiko in the history of Wei and Nihon Shoki. These texts and texts mentioned later in the syllabus are availble on LUNA in the folder "Course Materials".
Write a brief field study report about your visit to the temple. What did you observe, what were your impressions, what are your questions.
第3回: 4/25 Lecture: Religons in pre-historic Japan. Grave culture, shamanism; ruler and miko.
Read Chapter 3, the creation myth in Kojiki, and the records about Emp. Jingu Kogo and Ojin.
第4回: 4/27 SATURDAY One-day (9-5) field study tour, Osaka, south to north. We meet at Big Man in Hankyu Umeda Station, go by subway to Sumiyoshi Taisha 住吉大社. Next we go to Shintennoji 四天王寺,  Grand Cathedral of the Virgin Mary of Osaka 大阪カテドラル聖マリア大聖堂, and Kita Mido 北御堂 (True Pure Land Buddhism).
Write a field study report. Besides the text, include at least one phtograph and a poem (see instructions on Luna). Cost: transportation fee and lunch.
第5回: 5/2 Lecture: Encounter between local religions and new ideas from the continent: Confucianism and Buddhism. The first Buddhists in Japan and Shotoku Taishi.
Read chapter 4, and the excerpts from Nihon shoki and the Srimaladiva Simhanada Sutra.
第6回: 5/9 Lecture: Buddhism I - the teachings in the Nara and Heian periods

Read chapter 5
Read also chapters 2 and 25 of the Lotus Sutra
第7回:
Read chapters 6 and 7
Group assignment: Visit one of the following religious institutions, or one your group can agree on. Prepare a 10-minute presentation about the place and your visit there.
第8回: Read the article about Yoshida Shinto by Brown. Today's class will be focused on it.
第9回: Do a library reach on a topic directly related to Religions in Japan, and prepare a liste of literautre / sources you think would make a good basis for a reseach on that topic. Include the library number the material has at Kwansei Gakuin library.
第11回: 6/13 Lecture: Shinto and other religions in Imperial Japan I
第12回: 6/20 Lecture: Shinto and other religions in Imperial Japan II
第15回: The exam will consist of a few general questions related to the religions in Japan and an analysis of a a shorter religious text/ source.
トピック.授業外学習2: Extensive reading is encouraged, and inspiration from more advanced researchers a natural outcome.　Instructions on reference/citation are given in class and must be followed.

参考書/Reference books2: P. Swanson and C. Chilson, eds.
